Executive Summary of the Griffith Energy Facility:

Process Description

Griffith Energy is a 520-megawatt natural gas fired combined cycle electric generating facility with the peaking capacity of up to 650 megawatts. 
 
The on site reportable substance regulated under the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions (40 CFR 68) is anhydrous ammonia. Anhydrous ammonia is utilized at the Griffith Energy facility in the chiller system. Liquid ammonia is used as a refrigerant in the system that enhances gas turbine performance and efficiency during warm weather conditions by cooling the turbine inlet air. The ammonia is contained in various vessels, piping, evaporators and compressors that comprise the chiller system. All equipment used within the chiller system has been designed and constructed under codes and standards regulated by the ammonia industry.

Chiller System Prevention ProgramSafety

Griffith Energy maintains compliance with OSHA Standard 29 CFR 1910.119, Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals and 40 CFR 68, CAA Section 112 EPA Risk Management Program.

In addition to the required OSHA, EPA and corporate safety programs that are mandated within the facility, the following engineering and administrative controls will be in place to eliminate, or reduce the possibility of an accidental anhydrous ammonia release at the Griffith Energy facility:

?Computer Control System monitors and controls compressors, condenser, vessels and ammonia pumps. System displays continual operational status of equipment and controls alarms / shutdowns for out of parameter operation.
?    High level alarm and system shut offs are installed on pressure vessels. Abnormal operating levels sensed in the ammonia vessels will activate a shutdown of the chiller system compressors. 
?    Pressure relief valves are configured to all pressure vessels to eliminate the potential of an over-pressure condition within the vessels and the ammonia chiller system.
?    Emergency stop button ins

for evacuations, incident alarms and alerting.  Depending upon a given situation, the Golden Valley Fire Department would be called to provide assistance.

The Griffith Energy Facility currently has no planned changes to the ammonia chiller system, but will periodically review all opportunities to improve the safety of our personnel as well as the ammonia process.
